acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Ken Lopez Bookseller on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 21, 27, 30, 40, 45, 46, 42, 80, 87-89, 147 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 106-107 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The N. Scott Momaday Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: N. Scott Momaday Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: N. Scott Momaday
bioghist.p: N. Scott Momaday (b. 1934) is a Native American writer, painter, and activist of Kiowa descent. His mother, Natachee Scott Momaday, taught elementary school in the Navajo Nation. His father, Al Momaday, was a painter.

Momaday has written 17 books of fiction, poetry, drama and history. His novel House Made of Dawn received rhe Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1969. Momaday is the founder of the Rainy Mountain Foundation and Buffalo Trust, a nonprofit organization working to preserve Native American cultures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Papers, 1788-2012. II. Audiovisual Materials, 1965-2009. III. Electronic Media, 2002-2012.

did.unittitle: NOTEBOOK (1): AL & NATACHEE MOMADAY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One large black ringbound notebook with 85 8"x10" B&W photographs, plus numerous smaller B&W photos documenting the lives and activities of N. Scott Momaday's parents, artists Al and Natachee Momaday (1940s-80s). Includes various posed and unposed photographs of Al and Natachee Momaday. Also includes photos of both N. Scott and Al Momaday receiving joint Honorary Documents at Lawrence University; photos of President Harry S. Truman receiving a Native American belt from Vidal Cosiquinto (1952) and overseeing a Children's Art Contest (1951); numerous photos re: life at the Jemez Day School where Al Momaday was Principal and teacher (most 1960s); a Native American parade in which N. Scott Momaday was honored; A Native American beauty pageant at an Annual Arts & Crafts Exposition and Pow Wow (1968); shots of the first Indian and Western Artifact Show undated; The Momadays working on a mural; early (1960s) images of N. Scott Momaday, including graduation; a great shot of N. Scott Momaday in full headdress receiving the 1969 American Outstanding Indian Citizen's Award in Anadarko, OK; plus later images of Natachee Momaday and contact sheets

did.unittitle: PHOTOS BY N. SCOTT MOMADAY (1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One large black ringbound notebook with 38 8"x10" B&W photographs mounted on heavy cardboard, presumably taken by N. Scott Momaday of his first wife Gael; his children; Natachee Momaday; Al Momaday; et. al.

did.unittitle: PHOTOS BY N. SCOTT MOMADAY (2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One large black ringbound notebook with 33 8"x10" full-color digital prints, presumably taken by N. Scott Momaday of his father's death mask; Southwest landscapes and architecture; Soviet Union; Native American festivals and attire; petroglyphs; et. al. plus a shot of his Leicaflex camera
